columns.name: name
columns.description: The friendly name that identifies the app service plan

columns.name: id
columns.description: Contains ID to identify an app service plan uniquely

columns.name: kind
columns.description: Contains the kind of the resource

columns.name: type
columns.description: The resource type of the app service plan

columns.name: hyper_v
columns.description: Specify whether resource is Hyper-V container app service plan

columns.name: is_spot
columns.description: Specify whether this App Service Plan owns spot instances, or not

columns.name: is_xenon
columns.description: Specify whether resource is Hyper-V container app service plan

columns.name: maximum_elastic_worker_count
columns.description: Maximum number of total workers allowed for this ElasticScaleEnabled App Service Plan

columns.name: maximum_number_of_workers
columns.description: Maximum number of instances that can be assigned to this App Service plan

columns.name: per_site_scaling
columns.description: Specify whether apps assigned to this App Service plan can be scaled independently

columns.name: provisioning_state
columns.description: Provisioning state of the App Service Environment

columns.name: reserved
columns.description: Specify whether the resource is Linux app service plan, or not

columns.name: sku_capacity
columns.description: Current number of instances assigned to the resource.

columns.name: sku_family
columns.description: Family code of the resource SKU

columns.name: sku_name
columns.description: Name of the resource SKU

columns.name: sku_size
columns.description: Size specifier of the resource SKU

columns.name: sku_tier
columns.description: Service tier of the resource SKU

columns.name: status
columns.description: App Service plan status

columns.name: apps
columns.description: Site a web app, a mobile app backend, or an API app.
